prompt: Photorealistic macro shot of a single rare antique German handmade Latticinio Core Swirl marble resting on a piece of aged, dark wood. The focus is razor-sharp on the marble's intricate internal ribbons of color and the rough pontil mark at one pole. Soft, directional studio lighting highlights the glossy surface texture and the subtle imperfections in the glass. Shallow depth of field blurs the wooden background. Composition places the marble slightly off-center to the left, leaving negative space to the right, emphasizing its solitary beauty. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: rare-antique-marbles-identification-image-1.png

prompt: A flat lay composition viewed from directly above, featuring antique marble identification tools spread across a weathered wooden tabletop. Centered is an open, vintage-style marble identification guide with illustrations. To the left, a hand wearing cotton gloves gently holds a jeweler's loupe over a colorful Akro Agate corkscrew marble. To the right, a brass caliper measures a large Christensen Agate slag marble. Several other distinct antique marbles (e.g., a sulphide, an onionskin) are scattered nearby. Natural, soft window light illuminates the scene from the side. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: rare-antique-marbles-identification-image-2.png

prompt: A wide panoramic view of a curated collection of diverse rare antique marbles arranged neatly in rows within a long, shallow antique wooden printer's tray. Include distinct examples like earthenware Benningtons, painted Chinas, intricate handmade German swirls, and a clear sulphide featuring an animal figure. Shot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the variety and differences in texture, size, and pattern. Even, diffused lighting ensures clear visibility of details across all marbles. The tray fills the horizontal space of the 16:9 frame. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: rare-antique-marbles-identification-image-3.png

prompt: Dramatic close-up of a hand holding a translucent antique 'End of Day Cloud' marble, strongly backlit by a diffused bright light source (simulating holding it up to a window). The light shines through the marble, illuminating the complex internal structure, suspended color fragments, and air bubbles within the glass. The background is dark and out of focus, making the illuminated marble the clear focal point. The landscape composition captures the hand, the glowing marble, and the subtle gradient of light fall-off. Photorealistic, high detail. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: rare-antique-marbles-identification-image-4.png

prompt: An eye-level shot focusing on a section of a glass-fronted antique collector's cabinet with a dark velvet lining. Inside, several exceptionally rare and valuable marbles (like a large Onionskin Lutz, a Peltier National Line Rainbo, a pristine Sulphide) are displayed individually on small stands. Tiny, aged handwritten labels sit beneath each marble, hinting at identification and provenance. Warm, focused spotlighting from above creates subtle shadows and highlights the marbles' forms and colors, conveying a sense of history and value. The 16:9 aspect ratio shows a wide segment of the curated display. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6.0
name: rare-antique-marbles-identification-image-5.png
